result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Paul LaPointe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chad Paul LaPointe in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Chad Paul LaPointe in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 16 CM 108, 16 CM 109, 16 CM 355 and 16 CM 356.  State recites agreement - plead to 16 CM 107 and 16 CM 108 sentence w/held probation 2 years - costs - any counseling DOC may impose and 16 CM 109, 16 CM 355 and 16 CM 356 are dismissed and read-in.  DE entered plea of NC.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds DE guilty to 16 Cm 107 and 16 CM 108.  16 cm 355 and 16 CM 356 are dismissed.

COURT:  16 CM 107:  Sentence w/held probation 2 years - costs - any counseling DOC may impose and count 2, 16 CM 107 16 CM 109 are dismissed and read-in.
140 days credit time served

16 CM 108:    Sentence w/held probation 2 years - costs - any counseling DOC may impose and count 2, 16 CM 107, 16 CM 109 are dismissed and read-in.
140 days credit time served

ADA Marcoux: no objections.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
